pullRequest.body:
There was a bug in the congruence lemma generator used by `congr(...)` and `congrm` that would create congruence lemmas with unbound free variables if there were arguments after subsingleton instances.

Reported by Jireh Loreaux on [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113489-new-members/topic/what.20the.20heq.2C.20PosSemidef/near/434202080)


---

nodes.body: :v: kmill can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8747337184/job/24005628011)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8747337184/job/24005627493)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8747337184/job/24005627890)
If it's fresh on your mind, could you add a comment here explaining the meaning of `param`, `args`, and `letArgs`?

```suggestion
  - `argKinds'` is the accumulated array of `CongrArgKind`s, which is the original array but
```
Can you add a test with `_` too? Even if it errors, I think it's useful to check it errors in the right way.

I'm not sure I understand what that would be testing -- the but turns out not to have to do with `‹_›`. (It does work with `_` in place of `‹_›`, but that's because this argument can be solved for by unification with the goal.)

My thought is simply that this also fails on master;
```
import Mathlib

def f {α : Type} [DecidableEq α] (n : α) (_ : n = n) : α := n

lemma test (n n' : Nat) (h : n = n') (hn : n = n) (hn' : n' = n') :
    f n hn = f n' hn' := by
  exact congr(f $h _)
```
and testing both `_` and `‹_›` makes it clear that it is not a quirk unique to `‹_›`.

They both fail for the same reason, and I think it's important to follow the principle to test specific features.

That said, I added a `_` version, just to see that unification using the expected type actually works in this context. I'm still not convinced about testing this here, but I managed to work both versions into the same example.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix: make congruence lemma generator handle dependence
